meanings.definition: Engages in physical combat or struggle.
meanings.sent1: He wrastles with his brother playfully in the backyard.
meanings.sent2: The two friends wrastles for fun on the grass.
meanings.sent3: The puppy wrastles with a squeaky toy, trying to win the battle.
meanings.sent4: She wrastles with her fears every day, trying to overcome them.
meanings.sent5: The wrestler wrastles his opponent to the ground with skill and strength.

meanings.definition: To engage in a physical struggle or fight.
meanings.sent1: The kids wrastles over the last piece of cake at the party.
meanings.sent2: The siblings wrastles over who gets to sit in the front seat of the car.
meanings.sent3: The two cats wrastles over a ball of yarn, each claiming it as their own.
meanings.sent4: She wrastles with her conscience before making a difficult decision.
meanings.sent5: The competitors wrastles fiercely for the championship title.

meanings.sent1: The wrastles between the two teams was intense and exciting.
meanings.sent2: He watched the wrastles between the animals in the forest from a safe distance.
meanings.sent3: The wrastles between the siblings always ended in laughter and hugs.
meanings.sent4: The wrastles of nature can be seen in the changing seasons.
meanings.sent5: The ancient tale told of epic wrastles between gods and monsters.
